article.paragraph: Denis Colin Leary(born August 18, 1957) is an American actor, writer, producer, singer, and comedian. He was the star and co-creator ofRescue Me (U.S. TV series)Rescue Me, which ended its seventh and final season on September 7, 2011. Leary has starred in many motion pictures, most recently as CaptainGeorge StacyinMarc Webb's 2012 filmThe Amazing Spider-Man (2012 film)The Amazing Spider-Man, Cleveland Browns Head Coach Vince Penn inIvan Reitman's 2014 filmDraft Day, and the voice ofList of Ice Age characters#DiegoDiegoin theIce Age (franchise)''Ice Age'' franchise. As of 2015, he wrote and has been starring in the comedy seriesSex&Drugs&Rock&Roll, which premiered onFX (TV channel)FXon July 16.

article.heading: Career
article.paragraph: Leary began working as a comedian in the Boston comedy scene of the 1980s at the underground club Play It Again Sam's. But his first real gig was at the Rascals Comedy Club as part of the TV showThe Rascals Comedy Houron October 18, 1990. He also wrote and appeared on a local comedy series,The Late, Late Show, hosted by his friendLenny Clarkeand written by writerMartin Olson. Leary and Clarke both spoke about their early affiliations and influences in the Boston comedy scene in the documentary filmWhen Standup Stood Out(2006). It was during this time that he developed his stage persona. He also appeared in skits on theMTVgame showRemote Control (game show)Remote Control, playing such characters asKeith Richardsof theRolling Stones, the "brother" of co-hostColin Quinn, and artistAndy Warhol.citation neededMarch 2015

Leary first earned fame when he ranted aboutR.E.M.in an early 1990s MTVsketch comedysketch. Several other commercials for MTV quickly followed, in which Leary would rant at high speeds about a variety of topics, playing off the then-popular and growingAlternative rockalternative scene. One of these rants serves as an introduction to the video of "Shamrocks and Shenanigans (Boom Shalock Lock Boom)" byHouse of Pain. He released twoalbum (Music)recordsof hisstand-up comedy:No Cure for Cancer(1993) andLock 'N Load (album)Lock 'n Load(1997). In late 2004, he released theextended playEPMerry Fuckin' ChristmasMerry F#%$in' Christmas, which included a mix of new music, previously unreleased recordings, and some tracks fromLock 'n Load.citation neededMarch 2015

In 1993, hissarcasmsardonicsong about the stereotypical American male, "Asshole (song)Asshole", achieved much notoriety. However, this bit was allegedly stolen fromLouis CK, discussed by Louis on an interview on the "Opie and Anthony Show". It was voted #1 in anAustralianyouth radio poll (theTriple J Hottest 100).cite webhttp://www.abc.net.au/triplej/hottest100_08/history/1993.htmTripleJ Hottest 100-1993ABC RadioAustraliaThe song was used as part of theHolsten BreweryHolsten Pilsseries of ads in theUnited KingdomUK, in which Leary was participating, with adapted lyrics criticizing a drunk driver.cite webhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?vDenis Leary: 'He's An Asshole' - Anti-Drink Driving CampaignYouTubeJanuary 18, 2008August 27, 2011The single was a minor hit there, peaking at No. 58 in theUK Singles Chartin January 1996.cite bookDavidRoberts2006[[British Hit Singles & Albums]]19thGuinness World Records LtdLondon, UK1-904994-10-5315

Her second novel,The Good House, was published in 2013.cite webhttp://annleary.com/news/NewsAnn Leary, author of The Good House

Leary is anice hockeyfan and has his own backyard hockey rink at his home inRoxbury, Connecticut, with piping installed under the ice surface to help the ice stay frozen.cite webESPNBuccigrossJohnIt's a mad, mad world (and backyard) for us puckheadsJanuary 30, 2007December 1, 2012http://sports.espn.go.com/nhl/columns/story?columnistHe is a fan of theBoston Bruinsand theBoston Red Sox,cite webhttp://www.extremesportclips.com/video/1644/Denis-Leary-Rags-on-Mel-Gibson.htmlDenis Leary Rags on Mel Gibson - View VideoExtreme Sport ClipsAugust 12, 2007August 19, 2011as well as theGreen Bay Packers.cite webhttp://www.bing.com/videos/watch/video/learys-lowdown-on-boston-sports/12s6e3zbLeary's lowdown on Boston sportsBing.comAugust 19, 2011cite webhttp://incontention.com/2009/07/03/interview-20-questions-with-denis-learyINTERVIEW: 20 questions with Denis LearyIncontention.comJuly 3, 2009August 19, 2011

Leary describes himself as aJohn F. KennedyJack KennedyDemocratic Party (United States)Democratwith someConservatism in the United Statesconservativeideologies, such as support for the military. Leary has said of his religious beliefs, "I'm alapsed Catholicin the best sense of the word. You know, I was raised with Irish parents, Irish immigrant parents. My parents, you know, prayed all the time, took us to Mass. And my father would sometimes swear inIrish languageGaelic. It doesn't get more religious than that. But, no, after a while, they taught us wrong. I didn't raise my kids with the fear of God. I raised my kids with the sense of, you know, to me, Jesus was this great guy...."
article.heading: Leary Firefighters Foundation
article.paragraph: MainLeary Firefighters FoundationOn December 3, 1999, sixfirefightersfrom Leary's hometown of Worcester were killed in theWorcester Cold Storage Warehouse fire. Among the dead were Leary's cousin Jerry Lucey and his close childhood friend Lt. Tommy Spencer.In response, the comedian founded theLeary Firefighters Foundation. Since its creation in the year 2000, the foundation has distributed over $2.5 million (United States dollarUSD) to fire departments in the Worcester, Boston, andNew York Cityareas for equipment, training materials, new vehicles, and new facilities. Leary won $125,000 for the foundation on the game showWho Wants to Be a Millionaire (US game show)#Special editionsWho Wants to Be a Millionaire. Leary has close ties with 107.3/WAAF (FM)WAAF, which in 2000 released the station albumSurvive This!Part of the proceeds from this album were donated to the Leary Firefighters Foundation.citation neededMarch 2015

A separate fund run by Leary's foundation, theFund for New York's Bravest, has distributed over $2 million to the families of the 343 firemen killed in theSeptember 11 attacksin 2001 in addition to providing funding for necessities such as a new mobile command center, first responder training, and a high-rise simulator for theNew York City Fire Department's training campus. As the foundation's president, Leary has been active in all of the fundraising. In the aftermath ofHurricane Katrinain New Orleans, Leary donated over a dozen boats to theNew Orleans Fire Departmentto aid in rescue efforts in future disasters. The foundation also rebuilt entire NOLA firehouses.citation neededMarch 2015
article.heading: Controversy
Allegations of plagiarism
article.paragraph: For many years, Leary had been friends with fellow comedianBill Hicks. When Leary'scomedy albumNo Cure for Cancerwas released, many people believed Leary had stolen Hicks's act and material. The friendship ended abruptly as a result.cite bookBill Hicks: Agent of EvolutionBoothKevinBertinMichael2005Harper Collins0-00-719829-9In April 1993, theAustin Comedy Newsremarked on the similarities of Leary's performance, "Watching Leary is like seeing Hicks from two years ago. He smokes with the same mannerisms. (Hicks recently quit) He sports the same attitude, the same clothes. He touches on almost all of the same themes. Leary even invokesJim Fixx." When asked about this, Hicks told the magazine, "I have a scoop for you. I stole his [Leary's] act. I camouflaged it with punchlines, and to really throw people off, I did it before he did".cite webhttp://www.gavinsblog.com/probill.htmProfile: Bill HicksDougSternApril 1993Austin Comedy NewsOctober 22, 2006

At least three stand-up comedians have gone on the record stating they believe Leary stole Hicks' material, comedic persona and attitude.cite webhttp://blog.joerogan.net/archives/92Carlos Mencia is a weak minded joke thiefJoeRoganJoeRogan.netSeptember 27, 2005December 21, 2007cite interviewRoganJoePlayboyOctober 2003cite webhttp://www.billhicks.com/darktimes/other/darktimes20/faq/faq.htmlhttps://web.archive.org/web/20060320081614/http://www.billhicks.com/darktimes/other/darktimes20/faq/faq.htmlDark Times: Bill Hicks: Frequently Asked QuestionsTimMcIntire1998BillHicks.comOctober 11, 2006October 28, 2006One similar routine was about the bandJudas Priest, during which Hicks says, "I don't think we lost a cancer cure."cite AV mediaHicks, Bill1989Sane ManStand-up comedyUSARoadrunner Records

During Leary's 2003Comedy Central Roast, comedianLenny Clarke, a friend of Leary's, said there was a carton of cigarettes backstage from Bill Hicks with the message, "Wish I had gotten these to you sooner." This joke was cut from the final broadcast.cite newsZiano IIINick A.Roasting a comic, they turn up the flames, gentlyBoston Globehttp://www.boston.com/dailyglobe2/222/living/Roasting_a_comic_they_turn_up_the_flames_gently+.shtmlhttps://web.archive.org/web/20030811054820/http://www.boston.com/dailyglobe2/222/living/Roasting_a_comic_they_turn_up_the_flames_gently+.shtmlAugust 11, 2003August 10, 2003

The feud is also mentioned inCynthia True's biographyAmerican Scream: The Bill Hicks Story:quoteLeary was in Montreal to host the "Nasty Show," at Club Soda, and Colleen was coordinating the talent so she was standing backstage when she heard Leary doing material that sounded incredibly similar to old Hicks riffs, including his perennial [[Jim Fixx]] joke: ("[[Keith Richards]] outlived Jim Fixx, the runner and health nut dude. The plot thickens."). When Leary came offstage, Colleen, more stunned than angry, said, "Hey, you know that's Bill Hicks' material! Do you know that's his material?" Leary stood there, stared at her without saying a word and briskly left the dressing room.<ref name

According to the book, True said upon hearing a tape of Leary's albumNo Cure for Cancer, "Bill was furious. All these years, aside from the occasional jibe, he had pretty much shrugged off Leary's lifting. Comedians borrowed, stole stuff and even bought bits from one another.Milton BerleandRobin Williamswere famous for it. This was different. Leary had, practically line for line, taken huge chunks of Bill's act andrecordedit."

In a 2008 appearance onThe Opie and Anthony Show, comedianLouis CKclaimed that Leary stole his "I'm an asshole" routine, which was then expanded upon and turned into a hit song by Leary.cite videohttps://www.youtube.com/watch?vDenis Leary ripped off "I'm An Asshole" from Louis CKYouTubeOn a later episode of the same show, Leary challenged this assertion by claiming that he (Leary) co-wrote the song with Chris Phillips.cite videohttps://www.youtube.com/watch?vDenis Leary responds to Louis CK claiming he stole "I'm An Asshole" from himOpie & Anthony ShowNovember 18, 2008December 1, 2012YouTube
article.heading: Autism
article.paragraph: In his 2008 bookWhy We SuckWhy We Suck: A Feel Good Guide to Staying Fat, Loud, Lazy and Stupid, Leary wrote:quoteThere is a huge boom in [[Autism spectrum disorder|autism]] right now because inattentive mothers and competitive dads want an explanation for why their dumb-ass kids can't compete academically, so they throw money into the happy laps of shrinks... to get back diagnoses that help explain away the deficiencies of their junior morons. I don't [care] what these crackerjack whack jobs tell you — your kid is not autistic. He's just stupid. Or lazy. Or both.

In response to the controversy, Leary stated that the quote was taken out of context and that in that paragraph he had been talking about the trend of unwarranted over-diagnosis of autism, which he attributed to American parents seeking an excuse for behavioral problems and under-performance. Later, he apologized to parents with autistic children whom he had offended.cite webhttp://www.usmagazine.com/news/denis-leary-says-autism-Criticism-taken-out-of-contextDenis Leary Says Autism Criticism Taken 'Out of Context'October 16, 2008Us WeeklyMay 22, 2011https://web.archive.org/web/20081018134220/http://www.usmagazine.com/news/denis-leary-says-autism-Criticism-taken-out-of-contextOctober 18, 2008cite webhttp://news.bostonherald.com/news/regional/view/2008_10_28_Denis_Leary_Tells_Parents:_I_m_Sorry:_%E2%80%98Raising_Children_With_Autism__Deserves_Admiration__Comic_Says/srvcDenis Leary Tells Parents: I'm SorryLaurel J.SweetOctober 28, 2008Boston HeraldMay 22, 2011
